title: Henge
summary: There are three related types of Neolithic earthwork that are all sometimes loosely called henges.  The essential characteristic of all three is that they feature a ring-shaped bank and ditch, with the ditch inside the bank. Because the internal ditches would have served defensive purposes poorly, henges are not considered to have been defensive constructions (cf. circular rampart).
